item.title: A Quick Bibliometric Analysis on “Positioning”
item.description: I had a whim and wanted to do some quick bibliometric analysis on the topic of “strategic positioning”. The raw data is extracted from Web of Science. The search parameters: TITLE: ("strategic positioning" OR "industry positioning" OR "market positioning") Refined by: WEB OF SCIENCE CATEGORIES: ( MANAGEMENT OR BUSINESS OR ECONOMICS ) AND WEB OF SCIENCE CATEGORIES: ( MANAGEMENT OR BUSINESS OR INTERNATIONAL RELATIONS OR ECONOMICS ) AND DOCUMENT TYPES: ( ARTICLE ) AND LANGUAGES: ( ENGLISH ) Timespan: All years.

item.title: Optimal Positioning for Firms and Individuals
item.description: --- title: 'Optimal Positioning for Firms and Individuals' description: "Positioning Strategy for 'Standing out of the Crowd'" author: '' date: '2019-02-25' header_image: "/p_02252019_standing-out-of-the-crowd.jpg" slug: optimal-positioning categories: - strategy - positioning - business tags: - positioning - market categories twitter: card: "summary" site: "@oyakagi" T_image: "/p_02252019_standing-out-of-the-crowd.jpg" --- Imagine you are invited to a party. Probably you want to get noticed by other partygoers. Or at least you want to be recognized as a cool person by those who you are interested in and care about.
